column4: hi, how can i make a folder in /home/yancho/public_html be seen from php please? i dont want to do it for all the usernames just for yancho only. thanks
check the mod_userdir documentation for apache
http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.0/mod/mod_userdir.html
i think you need to set /home/yancho/public_html to be execCGI for a .php file in that location to be executale
from where pls shall i do that ? :)
http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.0/mod/core.html#options
edit the site config file and for the location directive of  /home/yancho/public_html (create one if it doesnt already exist) set the execcgi option in it
what do you mean exactly?
want to do this : http://cartoweb.org/cwiki/DebianPackages
the instructions are there on the page .. arent you reading it? :)
you arent reading it properly, slow down and make sure you undertand it well -- it says "To add in your /etc/apt/sources.list:" ... :)
gksudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list
u have a clue about these errors pls? : http://www.pastebin.ca/346350
I have a feeling that that repository you just added has packages that require odd version numbers (those for debian)
well, have you installed any software yet from that repository?

ok cool,  I think all you need to do is install the map-server packages from this repo and everything else from ubuntu's repo -- comment out this line in sources.list, run apt-get update , install the ubuntu packages like apache, php, postgres etc .. and then add the line back and then install the mapserver packages
can you paste again please?
does the command work on sdb2 ?
